adjective.description: Designating a larval stage of a crinoid at which it resembles a crinoid of the genus Pentacrinus in having a stalk and a calyx consisting of five plates.

noun.description: A larval crinoid which resembles a crinoid of the genus Pentacrinus.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Proceedings of the Royal Society of London. From scientific Latin Pentacrinus + -oid, perhaps after crinoid.
